name: Scale/extract columns
description:
Multiplies all elements of every columns #k by the corresponding weights[k]. If the length of weights array K is less than the number of columns M (block length), then the last missing M−K weights are supposed to be 1.0 (columns stays unchanged). If "weights_json" is set, it is used instead of "weights" array.
After this, some columns may be removed — see parameters.

in_ports.name: input
in_ports.hint: May be skipped, then the output will stay non-initialized

in_ports.name: weights
in_ports.hint:
Array of weights. It is supposed to have 1 row, but if not, its rows/columns structure is ignored.
May be skipped, then all weights are supposed to be 1.0 (no scaling).

in_ports.name: column_names
in_ports.hint: [Optional] List of column names, separated by \n (name of every column in a separate line).

in_ports.name: weights_json
in_ports.hint:
[Optional] Table of weights in JSON format: "NAME": weight, where NAME is a column name.
Here weight must be represented in one of following forms:
1) JSON number; 2) JSON string, actually containing a number; 3) JSON boolean value (false means 0.0, true means 1.0). 
If specified, "column_names" is required and the "weights" array above are ignored.

out_ports.name: column_names
out_ports.hint:
List of names of columns, which were not removed.
Returned only if the source "column_names" was specified.

controls.caption: Remove columns with weight=0.0
controls.name: removeColumnsWithZeroWeight
controls.description: If set, this function removes columns, corresponding zero weights. If all weights are zero and the number of weights ≥ number of columns, the result will be empty (non-initialized).

controls.caption: Remove columns, absent in weight JSON
controls.name: removeColumnsAbsentInWeightJson
controls.description: This flag is used only if "weights_json" is specified. If it is set, this function removes  columns, names of which are absent among the keys in "weights_json". If not, absent weights are considered to be 1.0 (columns stays unchanged).

controls.caption: Remove columns, filled by NaN
controls.name: removeColumnsFilledByNaN
controls.description:
If set and if the array length > 0, this function removes the columns, where all elements are filled by NaN. If all elements of the array are NaN, the result will be empty (non-initialized).
This flag has no effect for integer element types (NaN is possible for float/double values only).

controls.caption: Require non-empty result
controls.name: nonEmptyResultRequired
controls.description:
If set and if the result is empty (all columns were removed), this function throws an exception.
Note: if the source array is not specified (non-initialized), the result will also be empty (non-initialized) regardless this flag.
